answers.author: Mark Abeles-Allison
answers.text:
If you are prepared to make a significant capital expenditure you might want to consider the cost implications with a move to compressed natural gas (CNG).  Pricing per gallon, over time, with fueling intrastructure should still be around half of what normal fuel cost per gallon is.  Conversion cost of vehicles would also need to be considered though, about $8 - 10K per.

author: Izzy Murguia
text:
The City of Murrieta is currently exploring alternative options for fueling its fleet. City vehicles utilize unleaded and City fire apparatus utilize diesel fuel. 
Currently, the City owns one above ground fuel storage tank (unleaded) and leases 4 others from an outside firm who also supplies fuel for the City. We are experiencing issues related to the maintenance of the leased storage tanks which is causing issues in our fuel reporting system. We would like to use this as an opportunity to explore alternative options relating to fuel supply, including:
• Utilizing fleet cards 
• Purchasing our own storage tanks and bidding out fuel supply; and
• Bidding/Contracting for new pumps/storage tanks and fuel supply.
We are interested in how other local governments manage fuel for their fleets. Please share your experiences (pros/cons) regarding any of the above options, any agreements, RFPs, and studies conducted that your City may have undertaken regarding the subject.  
Thank you for your time!
title: Fueling Options
